tourBios.otherInfo: Played one event on PGA TOUR on 2001 and made three cuts in 14 starts on the BUY.COM TOUR...Member of the PGA TOUR 1985-96...Best career money list finish 32nd in 1988...Won the 1990 Mexican Open...Named All-Mid-American Conference three years. Honorable Mention All-American in 1983. Inducted into the Miami of Ohio Hall of Fame in 1993.

tourBios.otherCarHigh: Last played in a PGA TOUR event in 2004, when he competed at the B.C. Open. Was a full-time member of the PGA TOUR from 1985-96 and finished among the top 125 on the money list from 1985-95. Posted his lone victory, in 1988, when he birdied the fifth playoff hole to defeat Chip Beck at the Walt Disney World Oldsmobile Classic...Enjoyed his best year from an earnings standpoint on the 1991 PGA TOUR when he was a runner-up on two occasions (Southwestern Bell Colonial and The International) and finished with $386,759 for the 41st position on the money list. Finished 32nd on the 1988 money list, with $315,536. Also played a portion of his career on the Nationwide Tour, from 1998-2002. Won the 1990 Mexican Open. Named All-Mid-American Conference three years running and was honorable mention All-American in 1983 at Miami (Ohio). Inducted into the school's athletic hall of fame in 1993.
